Includes layout design, color schemes, multi-column formats, figure integration, and poster-specific best practices for visual communication.

security_audit.summary: This skill consists of documentation and LaTeX templates for creating research posters. The shell script performs PDF quality checks using standard utilities (pdfinfo, pdffonts, pdfimages). No network operations, no file modifications, no credential access. Legitimate academic content with no security concerns.

content.value_statement: Research posters communicate scientific findings at conferences and academic events. This skill provides ready-to-use LaTeX templates and comprehensive guidance for creating professional academic posters using beamerposter, tikzposter, or baposter packages with proper layout, typography, and visual hierarchy.
actual_capabilities: Generate publication-ready LaTeX posters with beamerposter, tikzposter, or baposter
Apply professional design principles for typography, color, and visual hierarchy
Create multi-column layouts optimized for scientific communication
Integrate figures, tables, equations, and QR codes into poster format
Verify PDF quality including font embedding, page size, and image resolution
Follow accessibility guidelines for color-blind friendly palettes
limitations: Requires a LaTeX distribution installed on the system
Does not generate or modify images or figures directly
Templates require user customization for specific content
Basic LaTeX familiarity recommended for effective use

use_cases.title: Conference Presentation Posters
use_cases.description: Create publication-quality posters for academic conferences with proper scientific formatting and design.

use_cases.title: Thesis Defense Posters
use_cases.description: Design effective research summary posters for thesis defenses and departmental presentations.

use_cases.title: Public Engagement Materials
use_cases.description: Develop visually compelling posters for public science events and interdisciplinary presentations.

prompt_templates.title: Create Basic Poster
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a LaTeX research poster using beamerposter for an A0 portrait poster about [research topic]. Include sections for Introduction, Methods, Results, and Conclusions with placeholder content.

prompt_templates.title: Customize Layout
prompt_templates.prompt: Modify the tikzposter template to create a 3-column landscape layout for my [discipline] research poster. Include my university branding colors and adjust font sizes for [specific size requirements].

prompt_templates.title: Add Visual Elements
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me integrate [number] figures into my baposter template. Show me how to add figure captions, subfigures, and a QR code linking to my paper. Use color-blind friendly color scheme.

prompt_templates.title: Quality Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my compiled poster PDF. Check that fonts are embedded, page size is correct for [conference requirements], image resolution meets 300 DPI minimum, and provide a checklist for final pre-print verification.

output_examples.input: Create a LaTeX research poster about machine learning applications in healthcare
output: Professional A0 portrait poster template ready for customization
Three-column layout with sections: Introduction, Methods, Results, Discussion, Conclusions
Color scheme recommendations using blue tones (professional, trustworthy)
Figure integration examples for data visualizations
QR code generation for linking to paper or code repository
Typography guidelines: Title 96pt, Headers 52pt, Body 28pt minimum
Print-ready checklist including font embedding verification

best_practices: Use 30-50% of poster area for visual content including figures, diagrams, and charts
Limit total text to 300-800 words with bullet points over paragraphs
Verify font embedding and image resolution (300 DPI minimum) before printing
Test print at 25% scale to ensure readability from 6+ feet distance
anti_patterns: Avoid cramming full paper content into poster format
Do not use font sizes below 24pt for body text
Avoid red-green color combinations that are not color-blind friendly
Do not leave placeholder text or Lorem ipsum in final poster

faq.question: Which LaTeX poster package should I choose?
faq.answer: beamerposter for traditional academic styles, tikzposter for modern colorful designs, baposter for structured multi-column layouts.

faq.question: What poster sizes are supported?
faq.answer: Standard sizes include A0 (841x1189mm), A1 (594x841mm), and North American 36x48 inches in both portrait and landscape orientations.

faq.question: How do I integrate figures into my poster?
faq.answer: Use includegraphics for images, tikzfigure for tikzposter, and subcaption package for multi-panel figures. Ensure 300+ DPI resolution.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only generates LaTeX source files locally. No data is sent anywhere. The quality check script only reads PDF files.

faq.question: Why do my fonts not embed in the PDF?
faq.answer: Compile with pdflatex -dEmbedAllFonts=true or use lualatex/xelatex for better font handling. Missing fonts may require installation.

faq.question: How is this different from PowerPoint poster templates?
faq.answer: LaTeX posters offer superior typography, precise layout control, and professional typesetting. They scale perfectly and handle complex math natively.
